ai.summary: Banstead Countryside Walk is a 26 km hard hike across varied UK countryside. The route blends woodland trails, fields, and quiet lanes with several elevation changes. It's aimed at experienced hikers who enjoy a demanding day on the trails; plan for a long outing and be prepared for weather and footing changes.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed surfaces: muddy tracks after rain, uneven grass paths, chalk footpaths, forested trails, hedgerows, and some road sections. Expect undulating terrain with a few steep sections, gates and stiles, and occasional exposure on open countryside.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather and daylight hours before you go. Wear sturdy, waterproof footwear and dress in layers. Bring a map and compass (or a reliable GPS) and ensure your phone is charged. Carry enough water and high-energy snacks; have a small first aid kit. Let someone know your planned route and finish time. Be cautious on gates, livestock crossings, and road edges; be aware that mobile coverage may be limited in rural areas. Start early in winter to maximize daylight.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good ankle support
Water bottle or hydration system (1.5–2 liters)
Weather-appropriate layers; waterproof jacket and hat/gloves if cold
Map and compass or GPS device; fully charged phone
Small first aid kit and emergency whistle
Headtorch or flashlight (in case of delays or low light)
Snacks and energy bars; portable high-energy food
Lightweight emergency blanket or foil blanket
Rain pants or gaiters (optional for very muddy conditions)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) typically offer the most comfortable conditions for a 26 km hike, with longer daylight and milder weather. The route can be done in winter with extra planning and caution for shorter daylight and wetter, more challenging ground.

seo.title: Banstead Countryside Walk – 26 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Plan your Banstead Countryside Walk, a 26 km hard hike through UK countryside. Terrain highlights, safety tips, gear suggestions, and best seasons.
